page.title: 06WINCANTON LOCAL NEWS-SUMMER
page.content: The major issue was the proposed {sports centre.}The town was divided over:1/ whether a swimming pool should be included, doubling the cost.2/ its location. The choice was between the town centre and King Arthurs school. Businessmen were reported to be angry over new charges for the collection of rubbish.The{bottle bank}was opened.Car {parking}was to be improved but there was opposition when a charge system was proposed. A notable event was the publication of Mr.Puffy Bowden's{book}"Wincanton: Pleasant Town on the Cale." The{sewerage works}were redeveloped. Everyone we asked in our shopping survey used{Wincanton shops}for at least some of their weekly groceries. Everyone also went shopping in Yeovil, often for electrical goods. Street was popular. Cities were used for gifts.
